Springs of water which gave large supply. This
saved his followers from destruction, & after
six days journey, on the seventh they expelled
the inhabitants of the country, & possessed a
territory in which they built thier city &
dedicated their temple.
4. Moses, to the end that he might for the future
Attach the nation to the his interests more
firmly, instituted new rites & different
from those of other men. All those things
which are considered sacred among us, are
there profane, every thing is permitted among
them which we regard as incestuous &
abominable. They have consecrated in
the most sacred recess of the temple an
image of the animal by which they were
preserved from perishing with thirst in
the desart, sacrifizing to his divinity
a ram, as in contempt of Jupiter Ammon.
